data.enText: if you unravel threads that are twisted, woven or knitted, or if they unravel , they become separated
data.chText: （把缠或织在一起的线）解开，拆散，松开

data.enText: I unravelled the string and wound it into a ball.
data.chText: 我把绳子解开并绕成一个球。

data.enText: to start to fail or no longer stay together as a whole

before.enText: of a system, plan, relationship, etc.

data.enText: to explain sth that is difficult to understand or is mysterious; to become clearer or easier to understand
data.chText: 阐释；说明；澄清；变得清楚易懂

data.enText: The discovery will help scientists unravel the mystery of the Ice Age.
data.chText: 这一发现将有助于科学家揭开冰川时代的奥秘。

tr: become or cause to become undone by separating the fibers or threads of

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 unraveling, unraveled

example.ex: His government began to unravel because of a banking scandal...
example.tran: 他的政府由于一起金融丑闻而开始瓦解。

example.ex: When she returned to America, the marriage unravelled.
example.tran: 她回到美国的时候，婚姻破裂了。

value.def: If something such as a plan or system unravels, it breaks up or begins to fail.

example.ex: He was good with his hands and could unravel a knot or untangle yarn that others wouldn't even attempt...
example.tran: 他的手很灵巧，其他人甚至都不敢尝试的一些难解的绳结或缠在一起的纱线，他都能解开。

example.ex: The stairway carpet is so frayed it threatens to unravel.
example.tran: 铺在楼梯上的地毯磨损得很厉害，都快散了。

value.def: If you unravel something that is knotted, woven, or knitted, or if it unravels, it becomes one straight piece again or separates into its different threads.

example.ex: A young mother has flown to Iceland to unravel the mystery of her husband's disappearance...
example.tran: 一位年轻的母亲飞抵冰岛，要揭开她丈夫失踪之谜。

example.ex: Gradually, with an intelligent use of flashbacks, Yves' story unravels.
example.tran: 通过巧妙运用倒叙手法，伊夫的故事慢慢呈现出来。

value.def: If you unravel a mystery or puzzle, or if it unravels, it gradually becomes clearer and you can work out the answer to it.
